Running a demo to show some of md_toc's capabilities...

usage: md_toc [-h] [-c | -i] [-l] [-m TOC_MARKER] [-p] [-v]
              [FILE_NAME [FILE_NAME ...]]
              {github,cmark,gitlab,commonmarker,redcarpet} ...

Markdown Table Of Contents: Automatically generate a compliant table
of contents for a markdown file to improve document readability.

positional arguments:
  FILE_NAME             the I/O file name

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -c, --no-list-coherence
                        avoids checking for TOC list coherence
  -i, --no-indentation  avoids adding indentations to the TOC
  -l, --no-links        avoids adding links to the TOC
  -m TOC_MARKER, --toc-marker TOC_MARKER
                        set the string to be used as the marker for
                        positioning the table of contents. Defaults to [](TOC)
  -p, --in-place        overwrite the input file
  -v, --version         show program's version number and exit

markdown parser:
  {github,cmark,gitlab,commonmarker

,redcarpet}

Please read the documentation to understand how each parser works

Return values: 0 ok, 1 error, 2 invalid command

# Hi

[](TOC)

hey

## How are you?           !!!

## fine, thanks

### Bye

## Bye bye

```python
# This is a code
# fence with comments that might represent ATX-style headings
# if not properly parsed
```

bye

# boo

Run with default options...
$ md_toc foo.md github

- Hi
  - How are you?           !!!
  - fine, thanks
    - Bye
  - Bye bye
- boo

No links and no indentation...
$ md_toc -l -i foo.md github

- fine, thanks
- Bye
- Bye bye
- boo

Inspecting the non-coherent file...
$ cat foo_noncoherent.md

Trying to parse a non coherent markdown file will raise an exception...
$ md_toc foo_noncoherent.md github

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/vm/md-toc/md_toc/__main__.py", line 34, in main
    result = args.func(args)
  File "/home/vm/md-toc/md_toc/cli.py", line 67, in write_toc
    list_marker=list_marker)
  File "/home/vm/md-toc/md_toc/api.py", line 288, in build_multiple_tocs
    list_marker))
  File "/home/vm/md-toc/md_toc/api.py", line 213, in build_toc
    raise TocDoesNotRenderAsCoherentList
md_toc.exceptions.TocDoesNotRenderAsCoherentList

Try to parse a non coherent markdown file without checking for coherence...
$ md_toc -c foo_noncoherent.md github

Use stdin, no links and no indentation...
$ cat foo.md | md_toc -l -i cmark -u '*'

* Hi
* How are you?           !!!
* fine, thanks
* Bye
* Bye bye
* boo

Editing the file in-place. As you can see, code fence detection still needs to be implemented for redcarpet..
$ md_toc -p foo.md redcarpet

[](TOC)

- [Hi](#hi)
    - [How are you?           !!!](#how-are-you)
    - [fine, thanks](#fine-thanks)
        - [Bye](#bye)
    - [Bye bye](#bye-bye)
- [This is a code](#this-is-a-code)
- [fence with comments that might represent ATX-style headings](#fence-with-comments-that-might-represent-atx-style-headings)
- [if not properly parsed](#if-not-properly-parsed)
- [boo](#boo)
